meanings.definition: In a mean or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: He behaved scurvily by lying about his actions.
meanings.sent2: The thief scurvily stole the wallet when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: The scurvily cunning fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through the air scurvily, leaving a trail of deception.
meanings.sent5: The dark figure moved scurvily through the shadows, unseen by all.

meanings.definition: In a shabby or unkempt manner.
meanings.sent1: The old house was scurvily decorated with peeling paint and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: She scurvily dressed in torn clothes and mismatched socks.
meanings.sent3: The scurvily dressed scarecrow looked more comical than frightening.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building stood scurvily on the corner, a reminder of better days.
meanings.sent5: The stray cat wandered scurvily through the alley, searching for scraps of food.
